Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the removal of graffiti from commercial and residential buildings, and in relation to establishing a process whereby the city may clean graffiti from these buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Imposing a fine against the owners of commercial buildings and residential buildings of six or more units who do not remove graffiti from their premises.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit to the council reports of crime in parks and playgrounds.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring NYPD to submit to the Council reports of crime in areas under the jurisdiction of the Department of Parks and Recreation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the possession and sale of graffiti instruments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Possession and sale of graffiti instruments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to community service for certain graffiti offenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Mandating community service for certain graffiti offenses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt legislation that provides for the civil commitment of sexually violent predators to protect the public from those whose mental abnormalities makes them likely to commit sexually violent crimes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Provides for civil commitment of sexually violent predators to protect the public from those whose mental abnormalities makes them likely to commit sexually violent crimes.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting legislation increasing the number of sex offenders required to register for life.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring all sex offenders to register for life.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to increase penalties for those who commit sex offenses against children, similar to provisions adopted in Florida as part of the Jessica Lunsford Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Enact sex offense provisions similar to those adopted in Florida, as part of the Jessica Lunsford Act.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of legislation that improves the national program to register and monitor individuals who commit sex offenses against children.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Support of U.S. Senate bill S.1086, which improves the national program to register and monitor individuals who commit sex offenses.
